importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news announcement, indicating when the death of Doug Martin was publicly reported.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 through his final seasons with the Buccaneers and Raiders.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after playing at Boise State.
He rushed for 1,454 yards and 11 touchdowns as a rookie, earning a Pro Bowl berth.
In 2015, he had 1,402 yards and six touchdowns and earned first-team All-Pro honors.
Over his career, Martin accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Buccaneers issued a statement expressing deep sadness over his passing and acknowledging his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th anniversary celebration. The Buccaneers and his family expressed deep sorrow over his sudden passing, with the cause of death currently unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
